channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Furloughed Italian Fiat workers are struggling to pay their mortgages amid Stellantis crisis
item.description: Fiat workers have been in limbo for a year as parent Stellantis fights falling sales.

item.title: Liam Payne, 31, Former One Direction Singer, Dies in Fall in Argentina
item.description: Payne, who was one of the group’s standout singers, fell from the third floor of a hotel in Buenos Aires, emergency services officials said.

item.title: Liam Payne Remembered by Charlie Puth, the Backstreet Boys and Other Musicians
item.description: Hours after news broke that Payne had fallen from a hotel balcony in Buenos Aires, his fans and collaborators shared their shock and grief.

item.title: Alone in the Dark: The Nightmare of Bangladesh’s Secret Underground Prison

item.title: Live Updates: U.S. Strikes Houthi Weapons Caches in Yemen
item.description: The attack on underground weapons facilities in areas of Yemen controlled by the Iranian-backed militia could also serve as a warning to Tehran.

item.title: Peru Pañamarca Archaeological Site Finds ‘Hall of the Braided Serpents’
item.description: Archaeologists have unearthed a richly decorated throne room and a “Hall of the Braided Serpents” from the Moche culture, with clues that a woman may ...

item.title: People with felony records can now vote in Nebraska—and that could make a big difference in November
item.description: Nebraska’s top election official had no authority to strip voting rights from people convicted of a felony, the state Supreme Court ruled Wednesday.

item.title: Amazon joins the nuclear party
item.description: Google, Microsoft, and now Amazon are in pursuit of power. Literally and figuratively.

item.title: Harris and Trump release new policy details in interview blitz as campaign comes to the end
item.description: Here are some takeaways from the cascade of appearances.

item.title: This $350 Oura Ring 4 Tracks Your Sleep. Is It Worth the Splurge?
item.description: The $350 Oura Ring 4 looks sleek and cool, and it may be useful for data-hungry health enthusiasts. But it failed this sleep-deprived parent.

item.title: Indian Doctors Go on Hunger Strike to Protest Killing of Colleague
item.description: Six were subsisting only on water and were admitted into the hospital after a multiday fast to demand justice for the brutal rape and killing of a med...

item.title: Harris’s Contentious Fox Interview, and Italy Expands Surrogacy Ban
item.description: Plus, One Direction’s Liam Payne dies at 31.

item.title: U.S. Bombs Houthi Weapons Caches in Yemen
item.description: Air Force B-2 bombers struck five underground weapons facilities in what may be a signal from the Biden administration to Iran.

item.title: Musk’s empire risks being targeted by EU for potential X fines
item.description: The EU may target Elon Musk’s broader business empire for X fines, potentially including revenue from SpaceX and Neuralink to increase penalties.
